
# Solar/Light EH

**Ambient**

## Solar/Light EH

* Harvesting energy from light (sun or artificial), usually via photovoltaic (PV) cells that convert photons into electrical energy.

### Principle of Operation

* PV cells are made of semiconductor materials (commonly Si) with P-type and N-type layers. Photons hitting the cell cause electrons to be released, and a current is generated.

### Equations/Models:

* **Power generated by a PV cell**
    $$P_{\text{out}} = \eta G A$$
* $\eta = \text{cell efficiency}$, $G = \text{solar irradiance (W/m}^2\text{)}$ and $A = \text{cell area (m}^2\text{)}$

---

## Solar nano-rectenna

Solar nano-rectennas can also be used. They capture electromagnetic waves in the near IR, visible, and UV range, and transfers part of the captured power to a rectifier, which transforms this power into DC power.

## Schematic illustration of a PV energy harvester

**Diagram Components:**
Sun / Artificial light $\rightarrow$ Glass Panel $\rightarrow$ PN-Junction (The PV Cell) $\rightarrow$ Voltage regulator $\rightarrow$ Storage device $\rightarrow$ DC output

## ðŸ”† Solar/Light EH

### **Advantages:**

* **Mature Technology:** Well-established technology with extensive research and development.
* **Relatively high power density under good illumination** ($\sim 100 \text{ mW/cm}^2$ in daylight).

### **Disadvantages:**

* **It can be intermittent:** In the case of solar EH, no power at night, lower output under shading or bad weather.
* **PV output varies nonlinearly with irradiance & temperature.** It requires **Maximum Power Point Tracking (MPPT)** techniques to find and maintain the optimal operating voltage and current that yields the max available power.
* **Indoor/artificial light harvesting is less efficient** ($\sim 1/3$ solar).

---

### **Harvester Comparison**

| Harvester type | Average Power/Voltage | Efficiency | Circuit complexity | Others | Application domain |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| Ecosence and econode | NA | High | NA | Highly responsive | Long-distance IoT networks |
| BLE beacon | NA | NA | NA | NA | Transferring small information |
| Current Starved-Voltage Controlled Oscillator (CS-VCO) feedback quasi PV | $800 \mu\text{W}$ | NA | NA | Power uniformity and controlled voltage/current. | NA |
| Simple PV | $400 \mu\text{W}$ | High | Medium | High accuracy | Indoor IoT applications |
| Prediction algorithm | NA | High | NA | High accuracy | NA |
| PV indoor | $3.6-4.2 \text{ V}$ | High | Low | NA | Smart Buildings |
| Hybrid | NA | High | Medium | NA | Used in number of IoT applications |
